content.raw:
@{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} thanks - I got the same result

`[Dbg] [UserCommands.cc:488] Created entity [287] named [X1]`  
`[Msg] Loading plugin [ignition-rendering2-ogre2]`  
`No protocol specified`  
`[Err] [Ogre2RenderEngine.cc:338] Unable to open display: :0`  
`No protocol specified`  
`terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::RenderingAPIException'`  
``what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(3:RenderingAPIException): Couldn`t open X display :0 in GLXGLSupport::getGLDisplay at /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ogre-2.1-debbuilder/repo/RenderSystems/GL3Plus/src/windowing/GLX/OgreGLXGLSupport.cpp (line 789)``  
`./run_sim.bash: line 6:    49 Aborted                 (core dumped) ign launch -v 4 $@`

It is possible that for the first time I was running the previous image locally and it somehow remembers it \(???\).  Old image looks like this:

`gpu@gpu-desktop:~/subt_docker$ ./run.bash 64777efadabf tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [ros] command[roslaunchsubt_roscompetition_init.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01vehicle_topics:=0]`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [x1_description] command[roslaunch--waitsubt_rosx1_description.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01name:=X1]`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [x1_ros_ign_bridge] command[roslaunch--waitsubt_rosvehicle_topics.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01name:=X1laser_scan:=1stereo_cam:=0lidar_3d:=0]`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:773] Loading plugin. Name[ignition::launch::GazeboServer] File[libignition-launch-gazebo.so]`  
`[Msg] Recording to [/tmp/ign/logs]`  
`[Msg] Loading SDF world file[/home/developer/subt_ws/install/share/subt_ign/worlds/tunnel_circuit_practice_01.sdf].`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:773] Loading plugin. Name[ignition::launch::GazeboGui] File[libignition-launch-gazebogui.so]`  
`QStandardPaths: XDG_RUNTIME_DIR not set, defaulting to '/tmp/runtime-developer'`  
`[Dbg] [Application.cc:87] Initializing application.`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Application.cc:407] Create main window`  
`roscore/master is not yet running, will wait for it to start`

new fails like this:

`gpu@gpu-desktop:~/subt_docker$ ./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`  
`[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [ros] command[roslaunchsubt_roscompetition_init.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01vehicle_topics:=0]`

`[Msg] Loading SDF world file[/home/developer/subt_ws/install/share/subt_ign/worlds/tunnel_circuit_practice_01.sdf].`

content.html:
@Alfredo Bencomo thanks - I got the same result

[Dbg] [UserCommands.cc:488] Created entity [287] named [X1]
[Msg] Loading plugin [ignition-rendering2-ogre2]
No protocol specified
[Err] [Ogre2RenderEngine.cc:338] Unable to open display: :0
No protocol specified
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::RenderingAPIException'
what(): OGRE EXCEPTION(3:RenderingAPIException): Couldn`t open X display :0 in GLXGLSupport::getGLDisplay at /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ogre-2.1-debbuilder/repo/RenderSystems/GL3Plus/src/windowing/GLX/OgreGLXGLSupport.cpp (line 789)
./run_sim.bash: line 6: 49 Aborted (core dumped) ign launch -v 4 $@

It is possible that for the first time I was running the previous image locally and it somehow remembers it (???). Old image looks like this:

gpu@gpu-desktop:~/subt_docker$ ./run.bash 64777efadabf tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [ros] command[roslaunchsubt_roscompetition_init.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01vehicle_topics:=0]
[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [x1_description] command[roslaunch--waitsubt_rosx1_description.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01name:=X1]
[Dbg] [Manager.cc:523] Forked a process for [x1_ros_ign_bridge] command[roslaunch--waitsubt_rosvehicle_topics.launchworld_name:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01name:=X1laser_scan:=1stereo_cam:=0lidar_3d:=0]

roscore/master is not yet running, will wait for it to start
